text: Olga Ševcova (born 26 November 1992) is a Latvian footballer who plays as a midfielder for ÍBV in the Úrvalsdeild kvenna and has appeared for the Latvia women's national team. ==Career== Ševcova has been capped for the Latvia national team, appearing for the team during the 2019 FIFA Women's World Cup qualifying cycle. She became historic as the first ever in the Latvia women's national team to score against Sweden and any top 10 ranked national team in the UEFA Euro 2021 qualifier match played on 3 September 2019. Latvia was ranked 93 by FIFA and 43 by UEFA (5th last of all who entered) at the time, in contrast to Sweden's 6th place. ==References== ==External links== * * * Category:1992 births Category:Living people Category:Latvian women's footballers Category:Latvia women's international footballers Category:Women's association football midfielders
title: Olga Ševcova
